channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for UT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for UT

item.title: Report X-2023090516
item.description:
Report X-2023090516

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-04T18:16:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-05
  • City: NORTH SALT LAKE
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: LEAKING DURING TRANSIT, UNLOADED, PLACED INSIDE A HAZMAT BAG AND RED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: LOOSE CAP LEAKING CORROSIVE LIQUID SOILING THE DETERIORATING BOX AND CONTENT INSIDE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED INSIDE A HAZMAT BAG AND RED HAZMAT TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2023090509
item.description:
Report X-2023090509

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-04T18:16:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-05
  • City: LOGAN
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: As soon as package was discovered, it was immediately put in a tote upright into the cage for processing. DescribePack: The caps were loose causing them to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once package was put in tote upright it was brought to the cage. Once there it was looked into and inspected. Upon inspection I found the two caps loose and tightened them to prevent further spillage.

item.title: Report E-2023090750
item.description:
Report E-2023090750

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-06
  • City: GRANTSVILLE
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During inspection of the containment lot one of the trailers was noticed to have moisture showing. The onsite response team put on the proper PPE and entered the trailer and the container was found. there was approximately less than 4 quarts discovered That had leek from the bottom of the container. The team then overpacked the damaged container and put down absorbents to cleaned up the material on the floor of the trailer. Everything was put into a salvage drums to be properly disposed of.

item.title: Report E-2023090748
item.description:
Report E-2023090748

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-13
  • City: SALT LAKE CTY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 13, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1210 was damaged in a load shift and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in using hand tools. Crews then repalletized the undamaged product for further processing and shipping. All ink impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.
